import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

source.5034e2ae:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
source.28cd21bc:
#Calculating the ECDF for the AGE column
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(15,12))
x = np.sort(diabetes['Age'])
y = np.arange(1,len(x)+1)/len(x)
sns.set()
_ = plt.title("ECDF OF AGE")
_ = plt.plot(x,y,marker='.', linestyle='none')
_ = plt.xlabel('AGE')
_ = plt.ylabel('ECDF')
plt.margins(0.02)
plt.show()
source.a8d51c63:
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(15,10))
corr = diabetes.corr()
sns.heatmap(corr, 
         xticklabels=corr.columns, 
         yticklabels=corr.columns);
source.9a84fb11:
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(15,10))
data = diabetes['Outcome'].value_counts()

sns.barplot(data.index, data.values)
plt.xlabel('Outcome')
plt.ylabel('Count');
source.00416531:
# Calculating the ECDF for the Pregnancies column
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(15,12))
x = np.sort(diabetes['Pregnancies'])
y = np.arange(1,len(x)+1)/len(x)
sns.set()
_ = plt.title("ECDF OF Pregnencies")
_ = plt.plot(x,y,marker='.', linestyle='none')
_ = plt.xlabel('Pregnencies')
_ = plt.ylabel('ECDF')
plt.margins(0.02)
plt.show()
